channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Deep Neural Net with Dynamic Neuron Addition
item.description: X as the input matrix with dimensions(m, n), where m is the number of samples (batch size), and n is the number of input features, W as the weight matrix for the layer with dimensions (n, k), where k is the number of neurons in the layer.

item.title: DifAttack: Query-Efficient Black-Box Attack via Disentangled Feature Space
item.description: In addition, due to the avoidance of using surrogate models' gradient information when optimizing AEs for black-box models, our proposed DifAttack inherently possesses better attack capability in the open-set scenario, where the training dataset of the victim model is unknown.

item.title: Discrepancy Matters: Learning from Inconsistent Decoder Features for Consistent Semi-supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Semi-supervised learning (SSL) has been proven beneficial for mitigating the issue of limited labeled data especially on the task of volumetric medical image segmentation.

item.title: RPEFlow: Multimodal Fusion of RGB-PointCloud-Event for Joint Optical Flow and Scene Flow Estimation
item.description: Recently, the RGB images and point clouds fusion methods have been proposed to jointly estimate 2D optical flow and 3D scene flow.

item.title: Nearest Neighbor Guidance for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Detecting out-of-distribution (OOD) samples are crucial for machine learning models deployed in open-world environments.

item.title: Pre-training-free Image Manipulation Localization through Non-Mutually Exclusive Contrastive Learning
item.description: We argue that contrastive learning is more suitable to tackle the data insufficiency problem for IML.

item.title: Towards Real-World Test-Time Adaptation: Tri-Net Self-Training with Balanced Normalization
item.description: Test-Time Adaptation aims to adapt source domain model to testing data at inference stage with success demonstrated in adapting to unseen corruptions.

item.title: Interactively Learning Social Media Representations Improves News Source Factuality Detection
item.description: The rise of social media has enabled the widespread propagation of fake news, text that is published with an intent to spread misinformation and sway beliefs.

item.title: Nearest Neighbor Guidance for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Detecting out-of-distribution (OOD) samples are crucial for machine learning models deployed in open-world environments.

item.title: Unidirectional brain-computer interface: Artificial neural network encoding natural images to fMRI response in the visual cortex
item.description: While significant advancements in artificial intelligence (AI) have catalyzed progress across various domains, its full potential in understanding visual perception remains underexplored.

item.title: Multi-Source Domain Adaptation for Object Detection with Prototype-based Mean-teacher
item.description: Because of the use of prototypes, the parameter size of our method does not increase significantly with the number of source domains, thus reducing memory issues and possible overfitting.

item.title: Free Discontinuity Design: With an Application to the Economic Effects of Internet Shutdowns
item.description: Thresholds in treatment assignments can produce discontinuities in outcomes, revealing causal insights.

item.title: Structure Invariant Transformation for better Adversarial Transferability
item.description: In this work, we find that the existing input transformation based attacks transform the input image globally, resulting in limited diversity of the transformed images.

item.title: A Simple Text to Video Model via Transformer
item.description: Since both text and video are sequential data, we encode both texts and images into the same hidden space, which are further fed into Transformer to capture the temporal consistency and then decoder to generate either text or images.

item.title: Event Stream-based Visual Object Tracking: A High-Resolution Benchmark Dataset and A Novel Baseline
item.description: Tracking using bio-inspired event cameras has drawn more and more attention in recent years.

item.title: A Comparative Study of Population-Graph Construction Methods and Graph Neural Networks for Brain Age Regression
item.description: We conclude that static graph construction approaches are potentially insufficient for the task of brain age estimation and make recommendations for alternative research directions.

item.title: Class Incremental Learning via Likelihood Ratio Based Task Prediction
item.description: An emerging theoretically justified and effective approach is to train a task-specific model for each task in a shared network for all tasks based on a task-incremental learning (TIL) method to deal with forgetting.

item.title: RankVicuna: Zero-Shot Listwise Document Reranking with Open-Source Large Language Models
item.description: Researchers have successfully applied large language models (LLMs) such as ChatGPT to reranking in an information retrieval context, but to date, such work has mostly been built on proprietary models hidden behind opaque API endpoints.

item.title: Divide and Conquer in Video Anomaly Detection: A Comprehensive Review and New Approach
item.description: Video anomaly detection is a complex task, and the principle of "divide and conquer" is often regarded as an effective approach to tackling intricate issues.

item.title: Robust Sequential DeepFake Detection
item.description: However, existing methods only focus on detecting one-step facial manipulation.

item.title: QA-LoRA: Quantization-Aware Low-Rank Adaptation of Large Language Models
item.description: Recently years have witnessed a rapid development of large language models (LLMs).

item.title: REFORM: Removing False Correlation in Multi-level Interaction for CTR Prediction
item.description: We propose a CTR prediction framework that removes false correlation in multi-level feature interaction, termed REFORM.

item.title: Statistical Analysis of Quantum State Learning Process in Quantum Neural Networks
item.description: As a quantum analog of probability distribution learning, quantum state learning is theoretically and practically essential in quantum machine learning.

item.title: Effective Multi-Agent Deep Reinforcement Learning Control with Relative Entropy Regularization
item.description: It alleviates the inconsistency of multiple agents' policy updates by introducing the relative entropy regularization to the Centralized Training with Decentralized Execution (CTDE) framework with the Actor-Critic (AC) structure.

item.title: NDC-Scene: Boost Monocular 3D Semantic Scene Completion in Normalized Device Coordinates Space
item.description: Monocular 3D Semantic Scene Completion (SSC) has garnered significant attention in recent years due to its potential to predict complex semantics and geometry shapes from a single image, requiring no 3D inputs.

item.title: Are Human-generated Demonstrations Necessary for In-context Learning?
item.description: In this paper, we raise the fundamental question that whether human-generated demonstrations are necessary for ICL.

item.title: Navigating Text-To-Image Customization:From LyCORIS Fine-Tuning to Model Evaluation
item.description: Text-to-image generative models have garnered immense attention for their ability to produce high-fidelity images from text prompts.

item.title: Multi-Label Feature Selection Using Adaptive and Transformed Relevance
item.description: Multi-label learning has emerged as a crucial paradigm in data analysis, addressing scenarios where instances are associated with multiple class labels simultaneously.

item.title: Joint Communication and Computation Framework for Goal-Oriented Semantic Communication with Distortion Rate Resilience
item.description: Recent research efforts on semantic communication have mostly considered accuracy as a main problem for optimizing goal-oriented communication systems.

item.title: InternLM-XComposer: A Vision-Language Large Model for Advanced Text-image Comprehension and Composition
item.description: We propose InternLM-XComposer, a vision-language large model that enables advanced image-text comprehension and composition.

item.title: BLIP-Adapter: Parameter-Efficient Transfer Learning for Mobile Screenshot Captioning
item.description: This study aims to explore efficient tuning methods for the screenshot captioning task.

item.title: Efficient Post-training Quantization with FP8 Formats
item.description: Recent advances in deep learning methods such as LLMs and Diffusion models have created a need for improved quantization methods that can meet the computational demands of these modern architectures while maintaining accuracy.

item.title: ReMasker: Imputing Tabular Data with Masked Autoencoding
item.description: We present ReMasker, a new method of imputing missing values in tabular data by extending the masked autoencoding framework.

item.title: PRiSM: Enhancing Low-Resource Document-Level Relation Extraction with Relation-Aware Score Calibration
item.description: Document-level relation extraction (DocRE) aims to extract relations of all entity pairs in a document.

item.title: HyperTrack: Neural Combinatorics for High Energy Physics
item.description: Combinatorial inverse problems in high energy physics span enormous algorithmic challenges.

item.title: An AI Chatbot for Explaining Deep Reinforcement Learning Decisions of Service-oriented Systems
item.description: Compared to earlier work on natural-language explanations using classical software-based dialogue systems, using an AI chatbot eliminates the need for eliciting and defining potential questions and answers up-front.

item.title: UnitedHuman: Harnessing Multi-Source Data for High-Resolution Human Generation
item.description: A holistic human dataset inevitably has insufficient and low-resolution information on local parts.

item.title: VidChapters-7M: Video Chapters at Scale
item.description: To address this issue, we present VidChapters-7M, a dataset of 817K user-chaptered videos including 7M chapters in total.

item.title: AsymFormer: Asymmetrical Cross-Modal Representation Learning for Mobile Platform Real-Time RGB-D Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this work, we propose AsymFormer, a novel network for real-time RGB-D semantic segmentation, which targets the minimization of superfluous parameters by optimizing the distribution of computational resources and introduces an asymmetrical backbone to allow for the effective fusion of multimodal features.

item.title: DeepACO: Neural-enhanced Ant Systems for Combinatorial Optimization
item.description: As a Neural Combinatorial Optimization method, DeepACO performs better than or on par with problem-specific methods on canonical routing problems.

item.title: Forecasting large collections of time series: feature-based methods
item.description: In economics and many other forecasting domains, the real world problems are too complex for a single model that assumes a specific data generation process.

item.title: Linked shrinkage to improve estimation of interaction effects in regression models
item.description: We empirically show that borrowing strength between the amount of shrinkage for main effects and their interactions can strongly improve estimation of the regression coefficients.

item.title: Beam Enumeration: Probabilistic Explainability For Sample Efficient Self-conditioned Molecular Design
item.description: Generative molecular design has moved from proof-of-concept to real-world applicability, as marked by the surge in very recent papers reporting experimental validation.

item.title: 3D Indoor Instance Segmentation in an Open-World
item.description: We argue that such a closed-world assumption is restrictive and explore for the first time 3D indoor instance segmentation in an open-world setting, where the model is allowed to distinguish a set of known classes as well as identify an unknown object as unknown and then later incrementally learning the semantic category of the unknown when the corresponding category labels are available.

item.title: Q-Bench: A Benchmark for General-Purpose Foundation Models on Low-level Vision
item.description: To address this gap, we present Q-Bench, a holistic benchmark crafted to systematically evaluate potential abilities of MLLMs on three realms: low-level visual perception, low-level visual description, and overall visual quality assessment.

item.title: Free-Bloom: Zero-Shot Text-to-Video Generator with LLM Director and LDM Animator
item.description: Text-to-video is a rapidly growing research area that aims to generate a semantic, identical, and temporal coherence sequence of frames that accurately align with the input text prompt.

item.title: BoIR: Box-Supervised Instance Representation for Multi-Person Pose Estimation
item.description: Our new instance embedding loss provides a learning signal on the entire area of the image with bounding box annotations, achieving globally consistent and disentangled instance representation.

item.title: Accurate and Interactive Visual-Inertial Sensor Calibration with Next-Best-View and Next-Best-Trajectory Suggestion
item.description: Visual-Inertial (VI) sensors are popular in robotics, self-driving vehicles, and augmented and virtual reality applications.

item.title: UCF-Crime Annotation: A Benchmark for Surveillance Video-and-Language Understanding
item.description: Furthermore, we benchmark the state-of-the-art models of multiple multimodal tasks on this newly created dataset, including temporal sentence grounding in videos, video captioning, and dense video captioning.

item.title: Projected Randomized Smoothing for Certified Adversarial Robustness
item.description: Randomized smoothing is the current state-of-the-art method for producing provably robust classifiers.
